title: EastEnders bosses originally had a very different storyline in mind for Lee Carter, reveals Danny-Boy Hatchard

EastEnders bosses originally had a very different storyline in mind for Lee Carter. 
The Walford favourite has been battling depression for some time now and at Christmas he even contemplated suicide. 
Although he was talked out of taking his own life, he hasn't confided in his wife Whitney or family about his emotional turmoil. 
However, while his journey has gripped the nation, actor Danny-Boy Hatchard, who plays Lee, revealed that producers initially wanted to explore post-traumatic stress disorder with his character instead. EastEnders bosses originally had a very different storyline in mind for Lee Carter (Photo: BBC) 
Speaking on This Morning, the star revealed: "I think that was the route that they wanted to go down but they changed their mind because they wanted it to branch out to more people. So they went with a depression storyline." Read More 
Danny-Boy worked closely with support charity Samaritans in a bid to do the storyline justice. Danny-Boy Hatchard revealed producers had intended to explore post-traumatic stress disorder with his character (Photo: Rex Features) 
Having watched the emotional episodes back, the actor admitted he was "very proud" of what the show has been able to achieve. 
"If it was to start and finish in the space of a week, it wouldn't do it justice," he added. @It's been going strong for two and a half years now. 
"It can be hard to switch off but it's like any other job. My way of doing that is taking my dog for a walk and then coming back and picking up the script to learn my lines again. The actor opened up about his depression storyline on This Morning (Photo: Rex Features) 
"It is nerve wracking but I felt more honoured than anything. It is such an issue at the minute, especially with the stigma that surrounds it. 
"A lot of people have approached me, an incredible amount of kids, even younger than 16. It's incredible. It's the biggest reward ever to know you've reached out to someone and affected them."
